forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 18 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 39 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a low around 55. South southeast wind around 20 mph, with gusts as high as 36 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between three quarters and one inch possible.

weather_report:
The afternoon in Downtown San Francisco unfolds beneath a blanket of thick, grey clouds, casting a moody ambiance across the city. The rain has commenced, gentle yet persistent, with whispers of wind curling through the streets at a brisk pace. As temperatures dip slightly, this is no time for light layers; a sturdy raincoat, perhaps layered over a warm sweater, would be prudent. The landscape offers a curious sight, where the famed Golden Gate Bridge barely peeks through the misty embrace of the marine layer, the bay shimmering intermittently as ships glide silently by, almost spectral in their quietude.

As the evening approaches, the rain is expected to intensify, transforming the city into a canvas of soft sounds and muted hues. The prospect of a cozy evening inside beckons, where one might curl up with a book or explore a bustling cafe, while the world outside revels in the gentle rhythm of the falling rain. It invites an appreciation for the simple pleasures—sipping hot coffee, enjoying warm pastries, and perhaps sharing soft laughter with friends amidst the hush of the storm.
